column2: Jabru, the Ruler of the Underworld
Shimut, the Messenger of the Gods
Inshushinak, National God of Elam. God of Snakes and Water
Pinikir, Fertility Deity and Defender of Susa
Make a sacrifice to our Divine Mother
Make a sacrifice to the Mother Deity of Fertility and defender of Susa
Make a sacrifice to the our National Deity Inshushinak
You have sent invitations out for the New Year Festival celebrating the birth of the Godess Nortia
[From.GetTitledFirstName], your liege, has invited you to join [From.GetHerHim] for this years New Year Festival. There you will celebrate the birthday of the Godess Nortia.
I will have nothing to do with that nonsense!

[From.GetTitledFirstName] has declined your invitation to attend the New Year Festival! Apparently [From.GetSheHe] has no faith in Tinia, Nortia and the other gods, and instead follows the strange rituals of some other religion that is foreign to our ways.
Your vassals have arrived and the time of the New Year Festival is upon us.
At last, the time of the New Year Festival is upon us.
You and your vassals gather for the great feast your servants have prepared!
With the lamps still burning, you gather together with your liege and the rest of [From.GetHerHis] vassals for the great feast [From.GetSheHe] has prepared!
The feast has come to an end. Your vassals are returning home, but most seem to agree that the New Year Festival was well worth the trip.
The feast has come to an end. You and the other vassals are returning home, but you all agree that the New Year Festival was well worth the trip.
Dusk arrives and with that the citizens, priests and nobility prepare for a procession towards the Temple of Nortia
After reaching the temple the priests guide you in and towards the wall direct you to hammer a nail into the wall as a rite of fertility.
You have sent invitations out for Purulli celebrating the birth of the Godess Nortia
[From.GetTitledFirstName], your liege, has invited you to join [From.GetHerHim] for this years New Year Festival. There you will celebrate the birthday of the Godess Nortia.
I will have nothing to do with that nonsense!

[From.GetTitledFirstName] has declined your invitation to attend Purulli! Apparently [From.GetSheHe] has no faith in Hatti, Arinna and the other gods, and instead follows the strange rituals of some other religion that is foreign to our ways.
Your vassals have arrived and the time of Purulli is upon us.
At last, the time of Purulli is upon us.
You and your vassals gather for the great feast your servants have prepared!
With the lamps still burning, you gather together with your liege and the rest of [From.GetHerHis] vassals for the great feast [From.GetSheHe] has prepared!
The feast has come to an end. Your vassals are returning home, but most seem to agree that Purulli was well worth the trip.
The feast has come to an end. You and the other vassals are returning home, but you all agree that Purulli was well worth the trip.
You have sent invitations out for Nuntarryashas celebrating the season as well as Hatti
[From.GetTitledFirstName], your liege, has invited you to join [From.GetHerHim] for this years New Year Festival. There you will celebrate the birthday of the Godess Arinna.
I will have nothing to do with that nonsense!

[From.GetTitledFirstName] has declined your invitation to attend Nuntarryashas! Apparently [From.GetSheHe] has no faith in Hatti, Arinna and the other gods, and instead follows the strange rituals of some other religion that is foreign to our ways.
Your vassals have arrived and the time of Nuntarryashas is upon us.
At last, the time of Nuntarryashas is upon us.
With the lamps still burning, you and your vassals gather for the great feast your servants have prepared!
You gather together with your liege and the rest of [From.GetHerHis] vassals for the great feast [From.GetSheHe] has prepared!
The feast has come to an end. Your vassals are returning home, but most seem to agree that Nuntarryashas was well worth the trip.
The feast has come to an end. You and the other vassals are returning home, but you all agree that Nuntarryashas was well worth the trip.
The priests arrive at the sanctuary of Hatti and begin to pull out his statue as well as the statue of a large bull
Now that the priests have settled, we ask that Hatti bless our realm with gentle rains for prosperity and offer libation to the Storm Deity.
Celebrate the Autunm Festival of Haste Nuntarryashas, lasting for 50 days
Celebrate Purulli, the Hittite New Year
Celebrate the Festival of Nortia, the Etruscan New Year
